book.name: Arcane Ink: A guide to skin-deep magics and silvered tongues

data.name: Arcane Ink
entries: A well-appointed-shop in a major city; a shaman's tent in a tiny village; a witch's hut on a deserted coastline. In all these places and more, a fortunate and well-traveled adventurer might find a convenient and permanent - if costly alternative to spell scrolls, potions or magical artefacts in the art of magical tattoos.

data.name: Spells on Demand
entries: Simple in concept, tricky in execution, a magical tattoo largely resembles a spell scroll or magical item. It allows a character who has one to c ast one spell as shorthanded by the symbol inked into their skin when the tattoo is activated. The use of a magical tattoo does not require the use of a spell slot, nor is any given magical tattoo restricted to a specific class; a wealthy bard, for instance, might obtain a Glyph of Life Aura, or a paladin who has failed one too many saving throws against the Frightened condition might save her coin for a Glyph of Countercharm.

entries.name: A Multi-Faceted Art
entries: Arcane tattoos require a combination of skills. The glyphs must be done perfectly and on ver y specific areas of the body dependent on the spell. The enchanted inks must be mixed to the exactly correct proportions. Generally, only the eldest and wisest arc anists can perform this art alone, and most at least have an apprentice to help with the more mundane elements. A magical tattoo shop will generally have one arc anist to mix the inks, another to design the glyphs, and a third to actually wield the needle. This makes the process costly, but worthwhile when performed by experts.

entries.name: Location, Location, Location
entries: There is more to a magical tattoo than simply magical ink and the correct design. A magical tattoo can only be effective if loc ated in the right spot on the wearer's body. Two tattoos cannot share space on one spot on the wearer's body, as the interaction between the two glyphs nullifies the magic and can have unforeseen and devastating effects. Thus a character considering a permanent Glyph of Blade Ward might consider whether that is the tattoo that would serve them best long-term, or whether they should wait and save up for better things.

entries.name: Not Always Permanent
entries: For most people, tattoos are seen as a permanent piece of body art. However, in a world redolent of magic, true permanence is rare at best. magical tattooists provide the option of temporary versions of the permanent glyphs, allowing an adventuring party of means to experiment with what might serve them best in the long term, while filling the tattooist's coffers.

Likewise, an adventurer could pay a tattooist to remove a tattoo that is not as useful as they might like to replace it with something better. Of course, the ability to remove a magical tattoo does not only lie with benign tattooists looking to make some gold, and an unwar y adventurer might find their previously inked skin suddenly bare if they face the wrong foe.

entries.name: Unconventional Races
entries: While most races have no issues with being tattooed, an arcane inker may encounter some difficulties with the scales of a dragonborn, or a kenku's feathers. However, these unconventional races can still benefit from magical tattoos:

items: Magical tattoos on dragonborn involve painting the glyph onto the dragonborn's scales first, then applying the needle.

Feathered races such as the kenku tend to result in dyed feathers in the approximate shape of the glyph as the ink seeps into the feathers themselves. Magical tattooists need to be very careful of ink bleed, as if not handled carefully, the redistribution of the ink will affect the spell.
A similar situation occurs with furred races like the charr or tabaxi; the fur tends to absorb the ink at the root, changing the colours of their fur in the approximate tattoo design.

entries: For these races, the process of magical tattooing takes longer, and is more costly, but is still just as worth it as it is in any other race.

data.name: Piercings
entries: Some spells require more than ink on skin to perform correctly, and require a combination of magical jewelery and correctly applied piercings to fully engage with the wearer. A few suggestions for these will be available at the end of this book.

data.name: Limitations
entries: Magical tattoos are a double-edged sword. On one hand, a well-chosen ability could pry an epic last-minute win from the jaws of defeat. However, used incorrectly, these could break an entire game. A dungeon master who wants to use these may want to consider the following when making magical tattoos available in-game.

entries.name: Cost
entries: Placing limits on how a magical tattoo can be used, and how many times, is probably the best way of dealing with the inherent balance issues. After all, magical tattooing is a costly business, requiring specialised knowledge, tools and components to implement. Keeping the cost high encourages players to consider exactly what they want to get out of their magical tattoo, and how to fit their desires into their existing budget. This has the added advantage of being able to offer your players a new encounter as they tr y to raise money for that highly useful permanent tattoo... or even hunt for the raw ingredients requested by the tattooist, depending on setting.

entries.name: Duration
entries: In a magical setting such as this, there is no reason that a tattoo of this type needs to be permanent. When offering this option to players, consider a tiered price list: a signific ant but moderately affordable price for a single-use glyph that will fade after its first use, a barely affordable price for multiple but limited uses (three or five, depending on the effect) and a prohibitive price on a permanent mark.

Additionally, c are should be taken to ensure that a tattoo's abilities not be overused. Smaller tattoos should only be used after a short or long rest, or a certain number of times per day, as any other magical item.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: One way of making magical tattoos less of a game-breaker is to subject them to the same rules and restrictions as any other spell. While still c arr ying the advantages of not spending a spell slot and not being restricted by class, a tattoo that c asts a Concentration effect would still require concentration on the part of the wearer, so they could not have another Concentration spell in effect while the tattoo is active. This prevents the game-breaking 'dual Concentration spell' effect that 5e was designed to prevent.

entries.name: Location
entries: Another method of ensuring that players don't overstack themselves with magical tattoos is to restrict the number of tattoos they can wear. While not requiring attunement in the manner of most magical items, various types of tattoo must be inked onto certain spots on the body to be effective, which restricts the number and type. For instance, protective glyphs such as Glyph of Blade Ward and Glyph of Ice Armor are worn on the same spot over the breastbone, restricting a character to having only one of these at any given time.

entries.name: Level
entries: Spells granted to the wearer of a magical tattoo can only be at their lowest level, unless specific ally established to be at a higher level. For instance, a character might request a Fire Bolt with more oomph, and gain it at a higher level, at increased cost.

entries.name: Personal Advantage
entries: Additionally, magical tattoos should be restricted to spells that directly affect the target. While there could be some leeway in terms of spells that generate auras, or small-scale offensive spells such as Eldritch Blast or Fire Bolt, the spell contained in the tattoo should affect only the wearer or, at a pinch, require direct physical contact with a single enemy (for instance, Glyph of Contagion).

entries.name: Outside Factors
entries: Another way to reduce a tattoo's usage is to make it firmly part of the game world on a stor y level, rather than just another magical item. When world-building, consider that some countries might have laws against magical tattoos of that nature. Alternatively, perhaps the practice of magical tattooing is so well-known in the game world that enterprising arc anists and spellc asters have found ways to nullify or even steal magical tattoos. This adds an element of challenge and danger to simply having such tattoos, and creates a chance of the wearer being unable to use them.

entries.name: Availability
entries: Finally, one of the better ways of ensuring nothing too game breaking finds its way onto a character's skin is to restrict the availability of certain spells beyond the simple cost. While the option exists to allow your players to ask in character if a particular spell is available on a tattoo, thus letting the DM decide whether it should exist and how much it would cost if it did, it's better to have at least a general idea what would or would not be available in that particular location based on what you as the DM think would be reasonable for your campaign.

data.name: Suggestions
entries: What follows is a list of basic tattoos that might be available in any loc ation that designs and inks magical tattoos. Obviously DMs should feel free to create their own if they feel so inspired, and only make available those they feel would be relevant or reasonable for their own campaign. Pricing is up to the DM, and should be adjusted dependent on location, local rules and regulations, and how hard the players are willing to work for the advantages conferred by a magical tattoo.

data.name: Glyphs of Protection
entries: The more common magical tattoos are of the protective variety, designed to augment an adventurer's armour. Some of the designs are gifts from the gods, as clerics provide help with the glyphs in exchange for donations to their respective shrines. Others are created entirely by abjuration specialists of the various magical schools. Whatever the origin of the design, these tattoos tend to be small, discreet and imbued with protective magics.

entries.name: Glyph of Blade Ward
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Common}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An outstretched hand; in its palm is a series of triangles set to resemble a shield.}
This small glyph is worn on the breastbone, and is activated when slapped once with an open palm. On activation, the wearer gains the effect of {@spell Blade Ward}.

entries.name: Glyph of Blur
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i Three overlapping stylised humanoid shapes}
Worn on the breastbone and activated when slapped once with an open palm, this tattoo grants the wearer the effect of {@spell Blur}.

entries.name: Glyph of Countercharm
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A tiny air y circular pattern of wisps}
Worn behind the left ear and activated by tapping it three times in quick succession, this tattoo provides the wearer with the effect of Bardic Countercharm.

entries.name: Glyph of Duplicity
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i }
A stylised red mask with a silver-grey face emerging from it Worn on the breastbone and activated when slapped once with an open palm, this tattoo provides the wearer with the effect of Mislead.

entries.name: Glyph of Elemental Absorption
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Uncommon}

{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A diamond shape divided into four smaller diamonds; a stone in the top diamond, a flame in the lower, a stylised gust of wind to the right, a drop of water on the left.}
Worn on the breastbone and activated with a slap with an open palm, this tattoo grants the wearer the effect of {@spell Absorb Elements}.

entries.name: Glyph of Flame Shield
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A stylised flame pattern in red and gold on the right; a stylised frost pattern in white and silver on the left}
Worn around both wrists and activated by crossing the wrists together in front of the face, this tattoo grants the wearer the effect of {@spell Flame Shield}.

entries.name: Glyph of Freedom
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An iron- coloured broken length of chain}
Worn around the left wrist and activated with a slap with an open palm, this tattoo grants the wearer the effect of {@spell Freedom of Movement}. This affects the wearer ONLY.

entries.name: Glyph of Ice Armor
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A pattern of overlapping snowflakes resembling a round shield}.
Worn on the breastbone and activated when slapped once with an open palm, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Armor of Agathys}.

entries.name: Glyph of Investiture
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare}

{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An extensive spread of brown-green geometric patterns, silver-white snowflake patterns, blue-white cloud patterns or red-orange flame patterns, depending on the investiture.}

Worn across both shoulder blades to the fronts of the shoulders and down the upper arms, and activated by placing both hands on the shoulders, this tattoo grants the wearer the effects of either {@spell Investiture of Fire}, {@spell Investiture of Fire}, {@spell Investiture of Stone} or {@spell Investiture of Wind}. The tattoo can only grant one investiture, chosen on initial application.

entries.name: Glyph of Life's Breath
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare }
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A mid-sized winding green-gold sunburst and life's-flame design.}
Worn around the right wrist and up the back of the hand, and activated when the hand is flexed three times in quick succession, this tattoo casts {@spell Aura of Life} on the wearer.

entries.name: Glyph of Retreat
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Common}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A foot trailing stylised gusts of wind}
Worn on the right ankle and activated by stomping the right foot twice, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Expeditious Retreat}.

entries.name: Glyph of Sanctity
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A mid-sized silver-white life's-flame design}
Work around the right wrist and up the back of the hand and activated when the hand is flexed three times in quick succession, this tattoo grants the wearer the effect of {@spell Aura of Purity}.

entries.name: Glyph of Silvercloud
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Common}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A running humanoid shape enshrouded in silver mist}
Worn directly over the heart and activated by slapping the mark with an open palm, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Misty Step}.

entries.name: Glyph of Stoneskin
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A small grey stone golem, seeming to cling to the skin.}
Worn directly over the heart and activated by slapping the mark with an open palm, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Stoneskin}.

entries.name: Glyph of Undead's Bane
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A small skull surrounded by stylised green-gold flames.}
Worn on the breastbone and activated when slapped once with an open palm, this tattoo grants the wearer the effect of {@spell Antilife Shell}

data.name: Glyphs of Protection
entries: While many mercenaries and adventurers obtain magical tattoos for combat purposes, there are more uses for a magical tattoo than offense and defense. Enterprising arcane inkers have developed many alternatives to noncombative but useful magical effects.

entries.name: Glyph of Disguise
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Common}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An elaborate feathered mask in many colours.}
Work on the back of the neck and activated by stroking the left hand across it, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Disguise|Disguise Self}.

entries.name: Glyph of Farspeak
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A quarter-inch glyph of three tiny blue arrows pointing out towards the wearer's face.}

This tiny tattoo is worn right behind the right ear, and is activated when tapped. On activation, the wearer gains the ability to c ast the Message spell to any friendly target within range wearing the same tattoo (specific ally performed with the same batch of enchanted ink).

entries.name: Glyph of Flight
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A pair of iridescent dragonfly wings.}
Worn on the shoulder blades and activated by rolling the shoulders three times, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Fly}. This tattoo only affects the wearer.

entries.name: Glyph of Images
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Uncommon}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A small stylised blue eye surrounded by an intric ate golden oval design resembling a picture frame.}
Worn on the left palm, and activated by passing the right palm over the mark at a distance of an inch or less, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Silent Image}.

entries.name: Glyph of the Longstrider
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Uncommon}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A pair of brown boots adorned with silver wings.}
Worn one on each heel and activated by tapping the heels together three times, these tattoos grant the effect of {@spell Longstrider}.

entries.name: Glyph of the Mountebank
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare }
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A pattern of purple arc ane swirls surrounded by a door way arch.}
Worn directly over the heart and activated when slapped with an open palm; on activation, this tattoo casts {@spell Dimension Door}.

entries.name: Glyph of Owl's Sight
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A small tan owl with golden eyes that almost seem to glow.}
Worn on the right hand and activated by passing the right hand over the eyes, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Darkvision}. This tattoo only affects the wearer.

entries.name: Glyph of Self-Sacrifice
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A red-veined black blade in a pool of sc arlet blood.}
Worn on the right palm and activated when pressed to the forehead of the target, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Life Transference}.

entries.name: Glyph of Shapeshift
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare }
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A dark brown hand hooked into shining claws.}
Worn on the left shoulder and activated when stroked with the right hand, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Alter Self}.

entries.name: Glyph of Stealth
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A clump of green leaves in which are barely visible a pair of dark eyes.}
Worn on the left palm and activated when stroked with the right hand, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Pass Without Trace}.

data.name: Glyphs of Attack
entries: While most damaging spells do not take well to enchanted ink on skin, the most skilled arc anists have used all their ingenuity to translate some damaging spells into tattoos with inventive use of glyphs.

entries.name: Glyph of Elemental Fury
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An intric ate pattern of runic symbols in red, white, green, blue and black overlapping to form a circle.}
Worn on the palm of either hand and activated by pointing the hand palm-out at a target while saying the activation word, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Chaos Bolt|XGE}.

entries.name: Glyph of the Flame Warrior
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A gold-hilted red- orange dagger seemingly made of flame.}
Worn on the palm of the dominant hand and activated by clenching the fist and speaking the activation word, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Flame Blade}.

entries.name: Glyph of the Flaming Fist
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Common}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An intric ate pattern of red and orange flames.}
Worn on the backs of both hands and activated by slamming both fists together, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Burning Hands}.

entries.name: Glyph of Life-Theft
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Common}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A tiny black skull with glowing red eyes.}
Worn on either palm and activated by touching the target and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Vampiric Touch}.

entries.name: Glyph of the Lightning Strike
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A branching purple-white lightning bolt.}
Worn on the palm of either hand and activated by pointing the hand palm- out at a target and speaking the activation word, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Lightning Bolt}.

entries.name: Glyph of the Plaguebringer
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A greenish-grey near-formless blotch with rough black edges.}
Worn on the palm of the dominant hand and activated by touching a target and speaking the activation word, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Contagion}.

entries.name: Glyph of the Shadow Rogue
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Common}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A silver-hilted black dagger giving off wisps of charcoal grey shadow.}
Worn on the palm of the dominant hand and activated by clenching the fist and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of Shadow Blade.

entries.name: Glyph of Shock-Claw
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Common}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A delic ate purple-white lightning bolt pattern.}
Worn on the backs of both hands and activated by touching a target and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Shocking Grasp}.

entries.name: Glyph of Sudden Strike
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Common}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An extensive pattern of blue and silver chevrons.}

Worn on the shoulder blades extending down the arms to the backs of both hands, and activated by extending the arms palms-up and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Zephyr Strike|XGE}.

entries.name: Glyph of the Tiefling's Rebuke
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Rare}
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A pair of red eyes framed by a pair of dark grey horns.}

Worn on the palm of the left hand and activated by pointing the palm at a target that has attacked the wearer, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Hellish Rebuke}. This tattoo must be used as a reaction.

entries.name: Glyph of Wind's Fury
entries: {@i magical Tattoo; Very Rare }
{@b Player Description}: {@i An extensive iron-silver wind-gust design.}

Worn on the shoulder blades extending down the arms to the backs of both hands, and activated by extending the arms palms-up and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Steel Wind Strike|XGE}.

data.name: Magical Piercings
entries: Enchanted jewelery comes in many forms. While rings and pendants are the most common, arcane tattooists have found that the correct combination of metals and enchantments allow for enchanted jeweler y to be worn in more permanent ways.

entries.name: Allseer's Chain
entries: {@i Wondrous Item, Very Rare}
{@b Player Description}: {@i A delic ate gold eyebrow ring with a small purple bead, linked to a matching earring by a very fine gold chain}
Worn through the top of the right ear and the right eyebrow, and activated by running a finger over the chain, this item grants the effect of {@spell Clairvoyance}.

entries.name: Babel Bauble
entries: {@i Wondrous Item, Rare}
{@b Player Description}: {@i A short post of bronze-ish metal with a flat cap adorned with almost invisibly tiny runes}
Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the tongue against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Tongues}.

entries.name: Bard's Barb
entries: {@i Wondrous Item, Rare }
{@b Player Description}: {@i A short post of dark metal with a pyramid-shaped cap on one end}
Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Vicious Mockery}.

entries.name: Farspeaker's Stud
entries: {@i Wondrous Item, Rare}
{@b Player Description}: {@i A short post of near-white metal, capped with a small white-gold sphere etched with what appear to be continents}
Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Sending}.

entries.name: Haunting Barb
entries: {@i Wondrous Item, Rare}
{@b Player Description}: {@i A short post of iron-like metal with a small c ap shaped like a snake's head on one end}
Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Dissonant Whispers}.

entries.name: Silver-Tongue Charm
entries: {@i Wondrous Item, Uncommon / Rare / Ver y Rare}
{@b Player Description}: {@i A short silver post with a tiny diamond cap on one end}

Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Friends}, {@spell Suggestion} or {@spell Charm Person}, depending on size of diamond and amount spent.

entries.name: Translator's Earpiece
entries: {@i Wondrous Item, Rare}
{@b Player Description}: {@i A small silver plate engraved with tiny runes and alphabets, attached to a bright red gem-stud}
Worn in the right ear and activated by touching the gem, this earring grants the effect of {@spell Comprehend Languages}.

entries.name: Tattoo
entries: A Magical Tattoo. Look at the Books on 5eTools for variant rules for how to acquire, design and include tattoo magic within your campaign.

entries.name: Jewelry
entries: A piece of Jewelry.
Personal ornaments, such as necklaces, rings, or bracelets, that are typically made from or contain jewels and precious metal.

item.name: Glyph of Images
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A small stylised blue eye surrounded by an intric ate golden oval design resembling a picture frame.}
Worn on the left palm, and activated by passing the right palm over the mark at a distance of an inch or less, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Silent Image}.

item.name: Glyph of the Longstrider
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A pair of brown boots adorned with silver wings.}
Worn one on each heel and activated by tapping the heels together three times, these tattoos grant the effect of {@spell Longstrider}.

item.name: Glyph of the Mountebank
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A pattern of purple arc ane swirls surrounded by a door way arch.}
Worn directly over the heart and activated when slapped with an open palm; on activation, this tattoo casts {@spell Dimension Door}.

item.name: Glyph of Owl's Sight
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A small tan owl with golden eyes that almost seem to glow.}
Worn on the right hand and activated by passing the right hand over the eyes, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Darkvision}. This tattoo only affects the wearer.

item.name: Glyph of Self-Sacrifice
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A red-veined black blade in a pool of sc arlet blood.}
Worn on the right palm and activated when pressed to the forehead of the target, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Life Transference}.

item.name: Glyph of Shapeshift
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A dark brown hand hooked into shining claws.}
Worn on the left shoulder and activated when stroked with the right hand, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Alter Self}.

item.name: Glyph of Stealth
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A clump of green leaves in which are barely visible a pair of dark eyes.}
Worn on the left palm and activated when stroked with the right hand, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Pass Without Trace}.

item.name: Glyph of Elemental Fury
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An intric ate pattern of runic symbols in red, white, green, blue and black overlapping to form a circle.}
Worn on the palm of either hand and activated by pointing the hand palm-out at a target while saying the activation word, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Chaos Bolt|XGE}.

item.name: Glyph of the Flame Warrior
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A gold-hilted red- orange dagger seemingly made of flame.}
Worn on the palm of the dominant hand and activated by clenching the fist and speaking the activation word, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Flame Blade}.

item.name: Glyph of the Flaming Fist
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An intric ate pattern of red and orange flames.}
Worn on the backs of both hands and activated by slamming both fists together, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Burning Hands}.

item.name: Glyph of Life-Theft
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A tiny black skull with glowing red eyes.}
Worn on either palm and activated by touching the target and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Vampiric Touch}.

item.name: Glyph of the Lightning Strike
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A branching purple-white lightning bolt.}
Worn on the palm of either hand and activated by pointing the hand palm- out at a target and speaking the activation word, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Lightning Bolt}.

item.name: Glyph of the Plaguebringer
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A greenish-grey near-formless blotch with rough black edges.}
Worn on the palm of the dominant hand and activated by touching a target and speaking the activation word, this tattoo allows the wearer to cast {@spell Contagion}.

item.name: Glyph of the Shadow Rogue
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A silver-hilted black dagger giving off wisps of charcoal grey shadow.}
Worn on the palm of the dominant hand and activated by clenching the fist and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Shadow Blade|XGE}.

item.name: Glyph of Shock-Claw
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A delic ate purple-white lightning bolt pattern.}
Worn on the backs of both hands and activated by touching a target and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Shocking Grasp}.

item.name: Glyph of Sudden Strike
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i An extensive pattern of blue and silver chevrons.}

Worn on the shoulder blades extending down the arms to the backs of both hands, and activated by extending the arms palms-up and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Zephyr Strike|XGE}.

item.name: Glyph of the Tiefling's Rebuke
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A pair of red eyes framed by a pair of dark grey horns.}

Worn on the palm of the left hand and activated by pointing the palm at a target that has attacked the wearer, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Hellish Rebuke}. This tattoo must be used as a reaction.

item.name: Glyph of Wind's Fury
entries: Magic Tattoo
{@b Player Description}: {@i An extensive iron-silver wind-gust design.}

Worn on the shoulder blades extending down the arms to the backs of both hands, and activated by extending the arms palms-up and speaking the activation word, this tattoo grants the effect of {@spell Steel Wind Strike|XGE}.

item.name: Allseer's Chain
entries: {@b Player Description}: {@i A delic ate gold eyebrow ring with a small purple bead, linked to a matching earring by a very fine gold chain}
Worn through the top of the right ear and the right eyebrow, and activated by running a finger over the chain, this item grants the effect of {@spell Clairvoyance}.

item.name: Babel Bauble
entries: {@b Player Description}: {@i A short post of bronze-ish metal with a flat cap adorned with almost invisibly tiny runes}
Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the tongue against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Tongues}.

item.name: Bard's Barb
entries: {@b Player Description}: {@i A short post of dark metal with a pyramid-shaped cap on one end}
Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Vicious Mockery}.

item.name: Farspeaker's Stud
entries: {@b Player Description}: {@i A short post of near-white metal, capped with a small white-gold sphere etched with what appear to be continents}
Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Sending}.

item.name: Haunting Barb
entries: {@b Player Description}: {@i A short post of iron-like metal with a small c ap shaped like a snake's head on one end}
Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Dissonant Whispers}.

item.name: Silver-Tongue Charm (Uncommon)
entries: {@b Player Description}: {@i A short silver post with a tiny diamond cap on one end}
Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Friends} depending on size of diamond and amount spent.

item.name: Silver-Tongue Charm (Rare)
entries: {@b Player Description}: {@i A short silver post with a tiny diamond cap on one end}

Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Suggestion}, depending on size of diamond and amount spent.

item.name: Silver-Tongue Charm (Very Rare)
entries: {@b Player Description}: {@i A short silver post with a tiny diamond cap on one end}

Worn through the tongue and activated by pressing the cap against the roof of the mouth for two seconds, this item grants the effect of {@spell Charm Person}, depending on size of diamond and amount spent.

item.name: Translator's Earpiece
entries: {@b Player Description}: {@i A small silver plate engraved with tiny runes and alphabets, attached to a bright red gem-stud}
Worn in the right ear and activated by touching the gem, this earring grants the effect of {@spell Comprehend Languages}.
